alert.note: Alert for Archer; Baylor; Wichita; Wilbarger (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued February 26 at 8:30PM CST until February 26 at 9:15PM CST by NWS Norman-Oklahoma City
info.description: The National Weather Service in Norman has issued a * Severe Thunderstorm Warning for... Archer County in northern Texas... Southern Wichita County in northern Texas... Southeastern Wilbarger County in northern Texas... Baylor County in northern Texas... * Until 915 PM CST. * At 830 PM CST, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from 3 miles north of Lake Kemp to 4 miles south of Millers Creek Reservoir, moving northeast at 65 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect damage to roofs, siding, and trees. * Locations impacted include... Wichita Falls, Seymour, Archer City, Iowa Park, Holliday, Megargel, Sheppard AFB, Lake Diversion, Dundee, Westover, Bomarton, Lake Kemp, Mabelle, Mankins, Lake Kickapoo, Lakeside City, Pleasant Valley and Cashion. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: A Tornado Watch remains in effect for the warned area. Tornadoes can develop quickly from severe thunderstorms. For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. Large hail and damaging winds and continuous cloud to ground lightning is occurring with these storms. Move indoors immediately. Lightning is one of nature`s leading killers. Remember, if you can hear thunder, you are close enough to be struck by lightning.
